meanings.sent1: She had a brazen attitude that shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The thief made a brazen attempt to steal the jewels in broad daylight.
meanings.sent3: Despite her brazen behavior, she always managed to get away with it.
meanings.sent4: His brazen disregard for the rules landed him in trouble.
meanings.sent5: The brazen lie he told was quickly exposed.

meanings.sent1: The brazen doorknob gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The brazen statue stood proudly in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The brazen bell chimed loudly, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent4: The brazen trumpet blared a triumphant tune.
meanings.sent5: The brazen jewelry shone brightly on her wrist.

meanings.definition: To face or endure with bold self-assurance
meanings.sent1: He brazened out the criticism and continued with his plan.
meanings.sent2: She brazened her way through the difficult conversation.
meanings.sent3: The student brazened through the challenging exam with confidence.
meanings.sent4: They brazened the storm and emerged stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: The team brazened the competition and emerged victorious.
